What It Is: Authenticity covers floral source, geographic origin, and purity (no added sugars). Adulteration includes dilution with syrups or mislabelling of origin.
Harvesting & Processing: Transparent handling, batch coding, and careful blending protect integrity. Avoid overheating which can degrade quality markers.
Properties & Uses: Monofloral honeys show distinct pollen and chemistry profiles. Consumers value provenance, raw handling, and traceability.
Market & Value: Premiums depend on verified origin and lab tests. Keep documentation for each batch to pass audits and assure buyers.
